title: (x) alternative for Corporate S - various {gang}
content: We are all aware of the typeface [Corporate S](http://web.archive.org/web/20070403075031/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090161000.html) from Berthold Types. Yes? I'm wondering if anyone knows of a suitable replacement. I feel awful putting it that way. Oh, the guilt! I know that once you do the math it is only $20 per font, but ... well ... any ideas? Is someone else licensing this typeface for less?
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
I may understand you, Tiffany, I always loved the look of 'Corporate A' ( the serif one )..   
( So, Maybe i am just going to save some more money, and buy it, in the, hopefully near, future.. )   
   
But, of course, I am thankful for any cheaper licenses, links and hints, too.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20070403075031im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Take Univers, change i (square) to i (round) and you've got Corporate S in better.   
   
(merde alors, I have no clue the g!)   
   
Anyway, about the Corporate S, the Q is very funny. And oh, the OsF, quite incredible! ;-)
Probably a stupid question, but why is the font called Corporate S? Sounds awkward.

Weidemann designs the corporate familiy for Mercedes-Benz. as far as I know,   
most glyphs based on the "golden cut". I love those faces especially the lc g,   
the corpo A small caps and the whole corpo E.   
   
I've done some work for daimler chrysler and used the urw-version of corporate.   
this version has a few bugs and its badly screen optimized.   
   
corporate A ntiqua   
corporate S ans   
corporate E gyptienne
